update.description: This adds a hierarchical profiler, which is useful to establish where run time is being used.  It also corrects some issues with IntrospectionManager using too much time to do needless copies.
update.title: Add GZ_PROFILE and IntrospectionManager speedup
update.reason: This will be updated to use the profiler from ign-common3.

content.raw:
Yes, but I think the better plan is going to be use the profiler from `common3`

Since the introspectionmanager fixes have already been merged in via [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3055/change-the-number-of-copies-that/diff](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3055/change-the-number-of-copies-that/diff), I’m going to close this and add the remotery-based profiler from common3 in gz11/default.

‌
content.html:
Yes, but I think the better plan is going to be use the profiler from common3

Since the introspectionmanager fixes have already been merged in via #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3055/change-the-number-of-copies-that/diff, I’m going to close this and add the remotery-based profiler from common3 in gz11/default.

‌

content.raw: @{557058:65740f22-cc56-4418-9608-7e17d0ed47b7} do we still want to port this to osrf/gazebo?
content.html: @Michael Carroll do we still want to port this to osrf/gazebo?

content.raw: that is now merged to `ign-common3`, but gazebo9-10 still uses `ign-common1`; perhaps we can backport the profiler to `ign-common1`
content.html: that is now merged to ign-common3, but gazebo9-10 still uses ign-common1; perhaps we can backport the profiler to ign-common1

content.raw: sounds good to me. we wouldn't want to use it within ignition-math or ignition-plugin, since those don't currently depend on ignition-common, but I think that's ok
content.html: sounds good to me. we wouldn't want to use it within ignition-math or ignition-plugin, since those don't currently depend on ignition-common, but I think that's ok

content.raw:
So I thought about this previously, and think it would be reasonable again.

How do you feel about me splitting this into just the patch to the IntrospectionManager and then moving the actual profiling into Ign-Common so that we can use it in other parts of the code base?
content.html:
So I thought about this previously, and think it would be reasonable again.

How do you feel about me splitting this into just the patch to the IntrospectionManager and then moving the actual profiling into Ign-Common so that we can use it in other parts of the code base?

content.raw:
I have a script that will convert it into the same format that the flamegraph tool uses: [http://www.brendangregg.com/flamegraphs.html](http://www.brendangregg.com/flamegraphs.html)

I’ll find it an include it with this PR.
content.html:
I have a script that will convert it into the same format that the flamegraph tool uses: http://www.brendangregg.com/flamegraphs.html

I’ll find it an include it with this PR.

content.raw:
There are a few style inconsistencies with the current Gazebo source code:

* snake\_case instead of camelCase.
* Variables starting with uppercase.
* Not using `this->` for invoking member functions.
* Missing `\brief`, `\param` and `\return` doxygen tags in some member variables and functions.
* Use `Get` prefix in some getters.

I totally understand that parts of this code have been borrowed from bullet. I don’t want to enforce it, just pointing it out in case you are interested in fixing it. I did a first pass in c85e7c0.
content.html:
There are a few style inconsistencies with the current Gazebo source code:

  • snake_case instead of camelCase.
  • Variables starting with uppercase.
  • Not using this-> for invoking member functions.
  • Missing \brief, \param and \return doxygen tags in some member variables and functions.
  • Use Get prefix in some getters.

I totally understand that parts of this code have been borrowed from bullet. I don’t want to enforce it, just pointing it out in case you are interested in fixing it. I did a first pass in c85e7c0.

update.description: This adds a hierarchical profiler, which is useful to establish where run time is being used.  It also corrects some issues with IntrospectionManager using too much time to do needless copies.
update.title: Add GZ_PROFILE and IntrospectionManager speedup

content.raw: @carromj, do you have any suggestion about how to test/visualize the profiling information with the utilities introduced in this patch?
content.html: @carromj, do you have any suggestion about how to test/visualize the profiling information with the utilities introduced in this patch?

content.raw: I need to test this on Windows, because the way that you define THREADLOCAL varies from Linux to Windows.
content.html: I need to test this on Windows, because the way that you define THREADLOCAL varies from Linux to Windows.
